conversation.content: [gasp loudly] Wait, what? Sarah got into MIT? With a—with a full scholarship? [very quietly] Oh my God. [pause] I just... wow. I mean, I knew she was brilliant but this is... [laughs] Remember when she first came to me? She couldn't even, um, she couldn't look me in the eye when she talked. [warm] And those presentations where she'd just freeze up completely, standing there with her note cards shaking. [chuckle] God, we practiced those speeches so many times in my office. [increasingly emotional] She'd get so frustrated with herself, you know? Like she thought being shy meant she wasn't... wasn't good enough somehow. [pause] But she kept showing up. Every week. Even when it was, er, really hard for her. [crying while speaking] And now MIT wants her. They're paying for everything. [sniffle] That awkward kid who used to mumble through every conversation is going to... [extremely happy] She did it! She actually did it! [laugh loudly] I need to call her right now. No wait, I should—I should get a cake or something. Do you get cake for this? [excited] Of course you get cake for this! MIT! [very sincerely] I'm just so proud of her.

subject: Discovering that the awkward teenager you mentored just got into their dream college with a full scholarship
